reviews.review: A classic. Well worth the money!

"Игра для убийства лысых нудистов", - ПЕКАЧЬ 1337, 12 July 2012 @ 7:46pm

Underwhelming game.  Didn't have the brilliant teamplay elements from Vavle's hit Left 4 Dead series.  The graphics look like Call of Duty 1 on the SNES.  There are far better zombie simulators for your money.  Call of Duty: World at War is a good example.  4/10.

This game is a wave based game where you have to survive waves of "zombies" (failed experiments to clone people). Between each wave, you get to buy weapons from the money you have earned from killing the "zombies". The wave ends once you have killed all enemies on the map. It gets increasing harder and there are tons of maps to play on. I would realy recommend this game if you like zombie games (even though there aren't any real zombies in this game). My only regret is that I suck at this game and there for haven't spent enough time on it.   I would seriously recommend getting this game though. Tons of fun to bge had especialy with multiplayer.
Zombies are special terriosts

Es un juego, de matar especimenes, en la ultima ronde aparece un especimen muy fuerte (Patriarch). Puedes cambiarte antes de jugar de jugador y de estilo de lucha ( Escopetero, franco, medico, ectr). Y las vas subiendo de nivel, al nivel 5 de un estilo de lucha que tengas subido, comienza las partidas con chaleco y cuando estan en nivel 6, chaleco y un arma, de pende de que estilo de lucha escojas. Por ejemplo: te cojes el de medico, pues empiezas con la primera arma de medicina que esta en la tienda + chaleco anti balas. Así que si te gusta matar a zombis, por que no a especimenes, tambien?. ¡¡Compratelo ya...!!.

i have killed many things, in many games. i have played the lone wolf, and i have played the story following robot. i have also been both while pretending to not help my team.

This game let my play it all.

Class based game. when you start a game, or join a server, you chose a class. You have 5 classes to chose from. you are allowed to change your class once per wave. depending on your settings or the servers, the number of waves can be different. at the end of each wave you can buy weapons at the trader, buy with cash you earn from kills. weapons for your class will cost less depending on your class, and your classes level.

and you have 10 different types of zombie/clone/monster(s).

Probably my most favorite game of all time. I've accomplished nearly everything this game has to be  accomplished and I still come back to it and still enjoy every moment.

It's an excellent, wave based survival shooter game placing you and your team against an army of zombie monster clones. The game doesn't revolve around teamwork like say L4D does, but having a good team will make all the difference.

Play it with friends, play it with strangers. Give it a try. I promise it won't disappoint.

Короче, можно было сделать и качественней (повторюсь - не в графике дело) но похоже компания не имела/имеет много средств на разработку чего-то более продуманного.

SUMMARY : Fun CO-OP Survival Horror for up to SIX players.
PRO's : Reasonable graphics (Old Unreal Engine). Decent sound effects and passable musical score . Ongoing PATCH and technical support from the developer.  Large worldwide community. Should be playable by almost all systems.
CON's : Limited gameplay scope ie the aim is just to survive long enough (up to 10 waves) to defeat the end boss. Does not have the depth of games like L4D or PAYDAY.
NOTES : Large number of STEAM Achievements (200+). Game regularly promoted by the developer through Events (Summer Sideshow, Christmass etc), free to play weekends, ongoing patches, free extra content (Maps, Weapons, Classes ...), etc. AI Bots DO NOT fill in for missing human players, like L4D or PAYDAY.

SINGLE PLAYER RATING : 2 STAR.
FRIENDS CO-OP RATING : 3.5 to 4 STAR.
ONLINE CO-OP RATING : UNSURE.
MULTIPLAYER : NOT APPLICABLE.

British currancy simulator is where you run about London England throwing money or 'Dosh' as it is more commonly known, at blokes where they in turn throw it either back at you, or other blokes who, in turn, throw it. It is a little known fact to anybody but the people who live there, but this is an accurate representation on how Englands economy works, and stock markets function as a whole. Should one ever run out of 'Dosh' it is less a crisis as a plesant trip to the local pub, which usually entails the aquisition of the nearest firearm, some sort of knife-like object, and a welding torch. Should none of these items be readily available to you, the next best option would be to put a paper bag over your head and lie down while you await the end of the world. For the rest of them who weren't just carved out of wood earlier that morning, you simply use your knife and or firearm and off one or two zombies* and you'll be back on your way to the market. *Caution: May contain zombies.

10/10

Killing floor is quite possibly one of the greatest (if not THE greatest) coop game ever made. Though some may compare it to l4d, it is entirely different. Whereas left 4 dead focuses mainly on making it to an objective whilst w+m1-ing all the way with weapons found lying around, killing floor focuses on the teamwork side of things. Without a communicating, coorperative team, winning a round is near-impossible. This attribute can be creditted partially to the perk system the game uses. By choosing from one of 6 possible perks, players can focus on different specimens to kill, strategies to use, and tactics to put into acion. Take the commando, for example. This perk focuses on assault rifles, and is unable to kill any large specimens. Paired with a sharpshooter, who can take out these specimens, but who has a difficut time taking out masses of them, they are unstoppable, the sharpshooter killing big guys and the commando kiling mobs of small ones. I cant say more b/c im out of space

Pure adrenaline rush , great FPS. Hardcore action and strategy, you start with minimal resources so teamwork is a must at the higher levels. Only drawback is a weak server browser interface and glitchy maps at times. Not very polished but a gem nonetheless.

If you like fast-pace action first person shooters, then this is the game for you. Decent graphics, TONS of replayability, very fun, and super intense. You team up with 5 friends and try and survive 4 to 10 waves (depending on server settings) of 100+ Zeds (not zombies) that continuously spawn all around the map. There are 9 different types of zeds (excluding the boss - which is fought on the last wave) and each zed has their own way/weapon of choise for killing you and your teammates, and a couple are VERY dangerous and VERY tough to kill. There are 7 different classes to choose from - all with their own special abilities, strengths, and weaknesses - and an ass load of weapons to choose from. I definitely recommend this game! Very fun!
